intro: Stoebe microphylla, commonly known as lesser cow-witch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 60 cm. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators like bees and flies.
